content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Certainly! Here is the function `extract_julia_code` in Julia that extracts all the Julia code blocks from a markdown document, removes the code fences, and joins the code blocks together with a newline:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    code_blocks = []
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    in_code_block = false
    current_block = []

    for line in lines
        if occursin(r"^```julia$", line)
            in_code_block = true
        elseif occursin(r"^```$", line)
            in_code_block = false
            push!(code_blocks, join(current_block, "\n"))
            current_block = []
        elseif in_code_block
            push!(current_block, line)
        end
    end

    return join(code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function processes the markdown document line by line, identifies Julia code blocks, extracts the code, and joins the blocks together with a newline.
